tool_description: A unified, headless API for any product on the internet.
name: Violet
title: Violet

api_list.name: /apps/{app_id}/webhooks
api_list.description: Retrieves a list of previously created webhooks.

remote_endpoint.description: Remote endpoint the webhook posts against.

api_list.name: /apps/{app_id}/webhooks/{webhook_id}
api_list.description: Retrieves a single webhook by ID.

remote_endpoint.description: Remote endpoint the webhook posts against.

api_list.name: /orders
api_list.description:
Returns a paginated list of orders.

Orders are limited to those placed by your app.

api_list.name: /checkout/cart/{cart_id}/price
api_list.description: Prices the cart. This includes the calculation of shipping and tax rates. Before pricing a cart the shipping address, billing address, shipping method, and any SKUs should be applied to the cart.

api_list.name: /auth/token
api_list.description: Refreshes a Users token. Pass the "refresh_token" value provided in the response body of a login request in the "X-Violet-Token" header.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://violet.p.rapidapi.com/auth/token"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "violet.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://violet.p.rapidapi.com/auth/token"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "violet.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /catalog/products/{product_id}
api_list.description: Retrieves a single product by ID. This request will include all offers of that product.

api_list.name: /catalog/products
api_list.description: Retreives a paginated list of all products in ascending order since date of creation.

required_parameters.name: exclude_public
required_parameters.description: Excludes all publicly available products that are not part of your curated catalog. In sandbox this should be left as false as there are no merchant <-> developer relationships and all products are publically available to all developers.

api_list.name: /checkout/payment/token
api_list.description: Obtain the current Stripe Publishable Key for use in tokenizing payment card data with the Stripe.js library.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://violet.p.rapidapi.com/checkout/payment/token"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "violet.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
